docs.snippet: After a vote-trading scandal by judges in 2002, skating officials overhauled the scoring and judging systems. But independent experts still question the sport’s credibility....
docs.lead_paragraph: After a vote-trading scandal by judges in 2002, skating officials overhauled the scoring and judging systems. But independent experts still question the sport’s credibility.
docs.abstract: Many in the competitive skating world, as well as independent experts, remain skeptical about sport's credibility, especially the objectivity of its judges; doubt remains 12 years after major overhaul of scoring and judging standards following scandal at the 2002 Olympic Games.

headline.main: Despite Revamp, Figure Skating Gets Mixed Marks

byline.original: By MARY PILON and JERÉ LONGMAN

docs.snippet: Gov. Chris Christie appeared on New Jersey 101.5 FM on Monday to answer questions from callers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie appeared on New Jersey 101.5 FM on Monday to answer questions from callers.
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column notes that New Jersey Gov Chris Christie took callers' questions about the George Washington Bridge scandal on the air at radio station 101.5 FM; says governor went into his default mode--talking a good political game but never really answering the challenges.

headline.main: Knee-Deep in Traffic-Jam Scandal, Christie Keeps Talking
headline.print_headline: Knee-Deep in Traffic-Jam Scandal, Christie Keeps Talking
